title: Augusta County: C. E. Dewey to Samuel Hunt, December 2, 1865
summary: In her report to secretary Hunt, C. E. Dewey predicts that large numbers of students will attend AMA schools after the Christmas holidays, as many of the "children are hired out till then." Commenting on local assistance for the AMA, Dewey states, "Three of the citizens, two women + a man, + one of the soldiers, have offered their assistance in the night school + two of them have commenced teaching with pretty good success, but they are not trained to the business + we see many defects."
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
